		Question: what form of government does canada
		Answer:
answer:
The answer is:

Canada has a parliamentary system of government. The Parliament of Canada has two chambers- the Senate and the House of Commons. The Prime Minister is the head of the government. The Governor General is the head of state and symbolizes the monarch. Canada is a federation of 10 provinces. The Senate is made up of 10 Senators for each province and the House of Commons is made up of members elected from each constituency. The Parliament of Canada was created in 18
